snippet: Serafima Leyfman, who spent thousands of dollars on her lymphoma treatment, said that the Soviet authorities didn’t tell her that the nuclear accident posed a threat to her health.
abstract: UJA-Federation of New York, one of seven organizations supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, provides Serafima Leyfman of Brooklyn with funds to cover her dental care and pay utility bills.
lead_paragraph: Serafima Leyfman, who spent thousands of dollars on her lymphoma treatment, said that the Soviet authorities didn’t tell her that the nuclear accident posed a threat to her health.

headline.print_headline: Settled in New York, but Still Within Chernobyl’s Reach
headline.main: Settled in New York, but Still Within Chernobyl’s Reach

keywords.name: organizations
